meanings.definition: To lend more than is necessary or appropriate.
meanings.sent1: She always overlends her books to friends, sometimes forgetting to get them back.
meanings.sent2: The bank warned him not to overlend money to strangers without proper documentation.
meanings.sent3: The librarian overlends books to the point where she can't find any on her own shelves.
meanings.sent4: His generosity overlends itself to situations where others take advantage of him.
meanings.sent5: Overlending can lead to financial troubles if not done responsibly.

meanings.definition: To extend a loan beyond the agreed upon terms.
meanings.sent1: The bank overlends the repayment period for customers facing unexpected difficulties.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to overlend the car rental period to avoid extra charges.
meanings.sent3: The teacher overlends the deadline for assignments, causing confusion among students.
meanings.sent4: The company overlends the project timeline, risking delays in completion.
meanings.sent5: Overlending time can create a false sense of security.
